provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. In this Act-
    "Authority" means the Private Security Regulation
         Authority established in accordance with this Act;
    "chairman" means the chairman of the Authority;
    "contract security organization" means an organization
         operating in the Island which provides secwiiy

         guards, to another organization or person;
     "bctions9*includes powers and duties;

     "private security organization" means a contract security
          organization, private investigator or a proprietary

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3 . 4 1 ) There is hereby established a body to be called the
Private Security Regulation Authority, which shall be a body
corporate to which the provisions of section 28 of the
Interpretation Act shall apply.
      (2) The provisions of the First Schedule shall have
effect with respect to the constitution of the Authority and
otherwise in relation thereto.

provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4 . 4 1 ) The functions of the Authority shall be to regulate
the private security industry and, without prejudice to the
generality of the foregoin*
     (a) to consider and determine applications under this Act
         for registration and for licences and the renewal of
         such licences;
     (6) to monitor the operations of private security organ-
         izations;
     (c) to make enquiries and collect information as it may
          think necessary or desirable for the purpose of
          carrying out its functions;
     (d) generally to take all such other lawful measures as it
         may consider necessary or desirable to assist it in
         carrying out its functions under this Act.                 0

provisions.content:

provisions.title: Section 23
provisions.content:
23.-(1) Subject to subsection (2) any person aggrieved Appeals.
by any decision of the Authority in respect of a cancellation
of a licence or registration under this Act, or in respect of
a refusal to grant or renew such licence or registration may.
within sixty days of such decision, appesl to the Minister.
        (2) Where an appeal is made under this section, no
action shall be taken by the Authority pursuant to section
20 until the appeal has been heard and determined.
       (3) Any person making an appeal under this section
may either in person or by his representative make oral or
written submissions to the Minister.
        (4) The Minister shall within fourteen days of the
hearing of an appeal under this section deliver his decisior:
in writing.

ter may appeal to the Court of Appeal which shall make
such order as it thinks fit.
